intro: Ricinocarpus bisetosus, commonly known as the hairy mangrove, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a shrub or small tree that thrives in saline and brackish water environments, typically found in mangrove forests. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain water in its saline habitat. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in clusters, and it produces fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
